default_permission.description:
This permission set configures if your
application can enable or disable auto
starting the application on boot.

#### Granted Permissions

It allows all to check, enable and
disable the automatic start on boot.

allow-disable.description: Enables the disable command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-enable.description: Enables the enable command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-is-enabled.description: Enables the is_enabled command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-disable.description: Denies the disable command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-enable.description: Denies the enable command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-is-enabled.description: Denies the is_enabled command without any pre-configured scope.

default_permission.description:
No features are enabled by default, as we believe
the clipboard can be inherently dangerous and it is 
application specific if read and/or write access is needed.

Clipboard interaction needs to be explicitly enabled.

default_permission.description:
No features are enabled by default, as we believe
the shortcuts can be inherently dangerous and it is
application specific if specific shortcuts should be
registered or unregistered.

allow-is-registered.description: Enables the is_registered command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-register.description: Enables the register command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-register-all.description: Enables the register_all command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-unregister.description: Enables the unregister command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-unregister-all.description: Denies the unregister_all command without any pre-configured scope.

default_permission.description:
This permission set configures what kind of
operations are available from the window state plugin.

#### Granted Permissions

All operations are enabled by default.

allow-filename.description: Enables the filename command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-restore-state.description: Enables the restore_state command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-save-window-state.description: Enables the save_window_state command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-filename.description: Denies the filename command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-restore-state.description: Denies the restore_state command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-save-window-state.description: Denies the save_window_state command without any pre-configured scope.
